sources.title: The Joke
sources.description: Jaromil Jireš’s brilliant adaptation of Milan Kundera’s novel tells the fragmentary tale of a man expelled from the Communist Party because of a political joke. After “rehabilitation” in the mines and a stint in prison, he hatches a revenge plot against the former friend who betrayed him. Made near the end of the Czech New Wave,  The Joke  is acknowledged as one of its greatest works.

metadata.Plot: In the 1950's, Ludvik Jahn was expelled from the Communist Party and the University by his fellow students, because of a politically incorrect note he sent to his girlfriend. Fifteen years later, he tries to get his revenge by seducing Helena, the wife of one of his accusers.
metadata.Writer: Milan Kundera, Jaromil Jires, Zdenek Bláha
metadata.Actors: Josef Somr, Jana Dítetová, Ludek Munzar
